Author: rot-and-poetry
Text: Oof, I feel this. My family is poor, so I feel guilty if I ever do anything that could be considered wasteful. The only difference is that I don't have guilt about purging food, so if I ever eat too much (i.e. everything that's put on my plate), I'll do that instead of trashing the food.

Author: eattillithurts
Text: well, yeah, i dont have a lot to spend too. and when i get something i often have to desice which is worth more, my health (mental too) or my money.  if your roommate is so nice to spend money on/for you, cant you ask him to get you cans with veggies? you can portion them and it has more fiber and vitmins than one warm pizza. talk to him, its no use to throw it away and hunger or eat it and freak out.  when i get somethign i dont want to eat, i gift it to someone else. no use to get all crazy and fuel more into my depression.  so, my advice, being poor is not a reason to not having an ED, but you should talk to your roommate and tell him one pizza is not a good way to spend $7. you could get so much bread, cheese and veggies for that, or a can of tuna, low calorie high protein.  you get what i mean
